results.title: Nobody ever died of old age
results.creator_credit: Herbert Danska, Films Incorporated and Henry Street Settlement
results.brief_description: Presents a series of character studies of what it is like to be old in America, as seen through the eyes of a young nurse and writer in both rural and urban settings. Reel two begins with a quick overview of the physiological signs of ageing. The film then examines the plight of old people, hospital treatment, old-age homes and accommodation in general. Good sharp dialogue used by main characters to highlight the plight of the unwealthy elderly.

results.title: Nobody's victim
results.creator_credit: Vaughn Ohern, Alan Barker, Self-protection Media for Women and Ramsgate Films
results.brief_description: Based on the book ‘Personal safety and self-defence for women’ by Pat F. Stock. Covers property and life saving precautions, and shows simple defence methods that every woman can use.

results.title: Nobody's Fool
results.creator_credit: Robert Benton, David Gropman, Scott Rudin, Arlene Donovan, Joseph G. Aulisi, Paramount, Cinehaus and Capella International
results.brief_description: Sully is a rascally ne’er-do-well approaching retirement age. While he is pressing a worker’s compensation suit for a bad knee, he secretly works for his nemesis, Carl, and flirts with Carl’s young wife Toby.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Benton, David Gropman, Scott Rudin, Arlene Donovan, Joseph G. Aulisi, Paramount, Cinehaus and Capella International
results.description: Sully is a rascally ne’er-do-well approaching retirement age. While he is pressing a worker’s compensation suit for a bad knee, he secretly works for his nemesis, Carl, and flirts with Carl’s young wife Toby. Sully’s long- forgotten son and family have moved back to town, so Sully faces unfamiliar family responsibilities. Meanwhile, Sully’s landlady’s banker son plots to push through a new development and evict Sully from his mother’s life.
description_for_label: Sully is a rascally ne’er-do-well approaching retirement age. While he is pressing a worker’s compensation suit for a bad knee, he secretly works for his nemesis, Carl, and flirts with Carl’s young wife Toby. Sully’s long- forgotten son and family have moved back to town, so Sully faces unfamiliar family responsibilities. Meanwhile, Sully’s landlady’s banker son plots to push through a new development and evict Sully from his mother’s life.

results.title: Nobody's children
results.brief_description: Looks at the issue of homelessness and youth in Australia. Part One called “No place like home” examines the growing underclass of alienated and dispossessed children in Australia. Part Two, entitled “Making it work”, looks at the effect of the collapsed youth job market on kids locked out of the workforce and at school.

results.title: Nobody's children
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: Beginning with the statement that, in the United States, one couple in seven is childless, this film illustrates the demand for children for adoption, describes the procedures followed and shows that the necessary strictness of these has led to one of America’s most pressing social evils - the “black market” in babies.

results.title: Noah's Ark (K)
results.creator_credit: Bill Justice and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: An updated version of the story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is inventive in its use of three-dimensional animation techniques that would be of special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Noah's ark
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Stephen Jones and Babelsberg International Film Produktion
results.brief_description: Australia provides the backdrop for this loose retelling of the eternal story of biblical hero Noah (Jon Voight), the great flood that destroyed the world, and the ark that was built by Noah and his family and housed two of every animal species. This made for television movie was not well received by critics, despite its international cast of Jon Voight, Mary Steenburgen and F. Murray Abraham.

results.title: No.1 = Number one
results.brief_description: Presented as a visual essay, without commentary, this film concentrates on the physical movements of a top German soccer goal-keeper in a straight time series from an actual game, through training to the big match.
